revised_title: Unfolding Transitions and Folding Energy of Titin Protein
tldr: The authors studied the unfolding transitions and folding energy of the giant protein titin, responsible for muscle elasticity. They found two unfolding transitions, both cooperative, and the second transition involved complete unfolding of immunoglobulin- and fibronectin-like domains. The folding energy associated with this transition is comparable to the energy required to extend titin molecules in situ, suggesting a possible role in muscle elasticity.
